commits.message: Add hints for the 'pd' Duplicate Panel command from PR #11264
Missed the 'p d' hint in the popup-menu
add missing word to graphite docs

Merge pull request #11375 from svenklemm/graphite_docs

doc: add missing word to graphite docs

Use net.SplitHostPort to support IPv6

- Add some tests
- Make error message more helpful

provisioning: removes id from dashboard.json

if dashboard json files contains `id` we
will just remove it form the dashboard model
before importing it into the database.

closes #11138

Add new currency - Czech koruna

Currency used in Czech republic.

Merge pull request #11384 from Rohlik/patch-1

Add new currency - Czech koruna

Merge pull request #11371 from towolf/add-duplicate-panel-hints

Add hints for the 'pd' Duplicate Panel command from PR #11264
changelog: adds note about closing #11102

notes about closing #9210

[skip ci]

Merge pull request #11379 from bergquist/provisioning_override_id

provisioning: removes id from dashboard.json
add value to text mapping

table panel: additional fixes for value to text mapping

Make the value to text mapping more similar to singlestat solution.
Adds more tests.
Also, allows string to be mapped to other string besides numeric values.
Merge pull request #11094 from infernix:value-to-text-upstream

alert: fixes broken link back to grafana

If Grafana was configured to use a subpath it
was included twice in the link from the
alert notification back to Grafana.

closes #11403

docs: not about email notifications and local img store

cloes #11054

tech: migrates to none deprecated mail lib

gomail is missing a maintainer so we are
switching to an active fork

ref https://github.com/go-gomail/gomail/issues/108

closes #7189

add fallback for gravatar in org/admin view

closes #11095

dashboard: allow alerts to be saved for new/provisioned dashboards

This changes the logic for the alert validation in the extractor. Validation
is executed twice, once before attempting to save the alerts and once after
saving the dashboard while saving the alerts to the db. The first validation
will not require that the alert has a dashboard id which allows new dashboards
with alerts to be saved.

Fixes #11247

issue.title: Improve the build tooling and CI/CD pipeline for Grafana
issue.body:
- [x] Document the steps in our current build & deploy process
- [x] Replace the current process with one based on the CircleCI 2.0 poc
  - [x] Create separate build container
  - [x] Add build to workflow
  - [x] Sign build artifacts
  - [x] Deploy build artifacts
  - [x] Testing and cleanup
- [ ] Seperate stable and beta release 
- [ ] Setup build for the build container
- [ ] Introduce xgo or golang-cross to be able to build for windows/linux/mac
- [ ] Figure out what the easiest things we can do to speed up the builds is
- [ ] Speed up the build (only low hanging fruit)
- [ ] Test changes on mysql, postegres and sqlite
- [ ] Run integration tests
- [ ] Simplify release (automate further)

comment.body:
@torkelo modified branch [here](/fg2it/grafana-on-raspberry/tree/fast-build-all) seems to works fine. Build on osx succeeded but is untested yet. Toolchain for osx is arguably less simple than win64 but is still easy (cf. this [repo](/docker/golang-cross) of docker which is quite similar to xgo for the osx toolchain itself, but stripped of all unneeded other tools). Will try to test the osx built (which by the way is only a zip and not yet a homebrew formula).
The whole thing, (armv6/v7/64/win64/asx) took less than 25 min cpu time to build (osx toolchain included) according to travis, and less than 10 min elapse (with 3 concurrent builds).

issue.title: Timestamps in CSV export for UTC dashboard are in local time
issue.body:
**What Grafana version are you using?** 5.0.1 
**What datasource are you using?** InfluxDB
**What OS are you running grafana on?** Linux

**What did you do?**
In a dashboard that's set to display charts in UTC, I did a CSV export. In the export, "Time Date Format" was kept set to the default `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ`

**What was the expected result?**
I expected the CSV export to contain ISO 8601 timestamps in UTC, e.g. `2018-03-26T19:14:00Z`.

This is indeed the behavior on an older Grafana 4.3 instance I was running previously, from where this dashboard was imported.

**What happened instead?**
The CSV export contained timestamps in local time, including timezone offset. E.g. `2018-03-26T15:14:00-04:00`. Attempts to work around this, such as removing the `Z` from the "Time Date Format" simply removed the timezone offset (e.g. leaving `2018-03-26T15:14:00` in local time).

This behavior persists whether exporting series as rows or columns, and no matter whether "Excel CSV Dialect" is ticked or not.

This behavior is also described in https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/10497, but somehow tagged as a "feature request". I believe it to be a bug, based on the following factors:
- Probably unintended change in behavior with respect to Grafana 4
- `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ` denotes the ISO 8601 format for UTC time. The `Z` should not ordinarily be interpreted as "timezone offset" - though I appreciate there is some ambiguity here

comment.body:
Just looked into this further. Looks like the change was actually implemented between 4.3 and 4.4.

_Before_ (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/blob/v4.3.x/public/app/core/utils/file_export.ts#L33):
```
dataArr[0][cIndex] = new Date(dp[1]).toISOString();
```

_After_ (https://github.com/grafana/grafana/blob/v4.4.x/public/app/core/utils/file_export.ts#L36):
```
dataArr[0][cIndex] = moment(dp[1]).format(dateTimeFormat);
```
I imagine there was some discussion on this at the time, and apologies for possibly having missed that, but I wanted to make sure this is indeed the intended functionality?

Unfortunately, with moment.js, it doesn't appear to be possible to force display of timestamps as UTC simply by adjusting the format string. And indeed, the `Z` format character simply translates to a numerical timezone offset (per https://momentjs.com/docs/#/displaying/format/).

I have a couple of suggestions of how to get around this, and wouldn't mind looking at submitting a PR if these sound attractive:
1) In export UI, add an option to convert the moment object to UTC (by applying `.utc()` method) prior to formatting to string.
2) As (1), but apply UTC conversion automatically if dashboard is set to display as UTC, and leave as local time otherwise
3) In export UI, add an option to convert to ISO string (by applying `.toISOString()` method), rather than `.format()`. This works as expected for moment objects, and recreates the 4.3 behavior.

issue.title: Avoid panic when GF_DATABASE_URL contains illegal chars
issue.body:
Handles the error gracefully and return an error to the user.

closes #11281

issue.title: Provide nightly builds for Windows
issue.body:
The build instructions for Windows on the website appear to be missing: https://grafana.com/grafana/download/5.1.0-13334pre1?platform=windows

I'm also having some major issues trying to build `master` on Windows, so that might be related somehow.

comment.body: @ryantxu thanks! I'm still a bit curious as to why grafana.com doesn't have the builds available though. In fact, it looks like all the 5.x nightly builds are missing Windows artifacts.

issue.title: Support dashboard variables in dashboard provisioning
issue.body:
What Grafana version are you using?
5.0.0-beta2

What OS are you running grafana on?
Docker & Chrome

What did you do?
I imported dashboards with datasources template variables

What was the expected result?
I expected to import those dashboards with default value from inputs and fill template variables

What happened instead?
Dashboard imported without filling template variables and when access those dashboards I see error
```
Datasource named ${DS_PROMETHEUS} was not found
```
It will be great if I can change those inputs later or import as dashboard template and later import them with correct input in the app.

comment.body: This seems like #11018, also.  Is this on the roadmap, or do I just need to work around it?

issue.title: Timestamps in CSV export for UTC dashboard are in local time (Grafana5)
issue.body:
**What Grafana version are you using?** 5.0.1 
**What datasource are you using?** InfluxDB
**What OS are you running grafana on?** Linux

**What did you do?**
In a dashboard that's set to display charts in UTC, I did a CSV export. In the export, "Time Date Format" was kept set to the default `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ`

**What was the expected result?**
I expected the CSV export to contain ISO 8601 timestamps in UTC, e.g. `2018-03-26T19:14:00Z`.

This is indeed the behavior on an older Grafana 4.3 instance I was running previously, from where this dashboard was imported.

**What happened instead?**
The CSV export contained timestamps in local time, including timezone offset. E.g. `2018-03-26T15:14:00-04:00`. Attempts to work around this, such as removing the `Z` from the "Time Date Format" simply removed the timezone offset (e.g. leaving `2018-03-26T15:14:00` in local time).

This behavior persists whether exporting series as rows or columns, and no matter whether "Excel CSV Dialect" is ticked or not.

This behavior is also described in https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/10497, but somehow tagged as a "feature request". I believe it to be a bug, based on the following factors:
- Probably unintended change in behavior with respect to Grafana 4
- `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ` denotes the ISO 8601 format for UTC time. The `Z` should not ordinarily be interpreted as "timezone offset" - though I appreciate there is some ambiguity here

issue.title: [Bug] New user logins to default Org instead of mapped in ldap.toml
issue.body:
We use LDAP auth with org mapping:
[[servers.group_mappings]]
group_dn = "grafana_editor"
org_role = "Editor"
org_id = 3

After new user logins for the first time(thru LDAP) - current organization for him still "1" but he don't have a rights for default Org and that cause error "Org missing" in main menu(near user name and avatar).
Only after manual change of current organization to mapped in ldap value(id = 3) it works as expected.

Is there any ways to force set current Org for first time logged user same as mapped in ldap.toml?
Or (best way) to fist organization for which user have an access?

ver: grafana-3.1.1-1470047149
Thanks

comment.body:
+1

Probably related: #11311 see [comment](https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/11311#issuecomment-376617873).
Looks like the Grafana team [is working on it](https://community.grafana.com/t/ldap-based-authentication-for-multiple-organizations/5988).

issue.body:
- Grafana version  = 5.0

i have on variable which is having values 100, 101, 102 and Multiple and All option is enabled, but when ever i chose All option grafana sending values like '100', '101', '102' but expected for postgres stored procedure is '100,101,102' so it is causing syntax error

issue.title: [bug] Can't create Data Source via localhost
issue.body:
- What Grafana version are you using?
grafana-5.0.3-1.x86_64.rpm
- What datasource are you using?
prometheus-2.2.1.linux-amd64
- What OS are you running grafana on?
CentOS 7.4 
- What did you do?
I tried to create Data Source for the Prometheus on http://localhost:9090/ 
- What was the expected result?
I would like install on the one server Prometheus and Grafana and to connect Grafana with Prometheus via localhost:9090 port and close the 9090 port in firewall for outside.
- What happened instead?
Changes to saved, connect-test is failed, I don't have text of test result, Granafa tried send requiest to localhost:9090 via MY browser, I saw metrics in the Prometheus web-interfase, but can't saw they in Grafana daskboard. If I tried introduce outside IP in URL - all is fine.

![grafana - mozilla firefox 2018-03-28 18 42 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/28757514/38041676-0ffb94ec-32bb-11e8-9864-51d967854975.png)

issue.title: Specify desired step in Prometheus
issue.body:
Previously we used to be able to specify the step parameter in Prometheus. This was changed in https://github.com/grafana/grafana/pull/8073

It would be nice to be able to get this functionality back to be able to display brief spikes in graphs.

comment.body:
Hi Alin,

I red most of your other threads on the subject and I much admire your
persuasiveness.

While I like p8s/grafana a lot, I find it practically useless for slow
moving counters. The fact that p8s considers range query as (,) intervals
and not as [,) intervals was quite surprising.

Therefore I will be eager to try your xrate function and friends.

If you can maintain a docker image that is similar to upstream releases +
your patches, that would be absolutely awesome.

Thanks again.

On Thu, 29 Mar 2018, 02:07 Alin Sinpalean <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> With apologies for hijacking this thread, I am considering maintaining a
> Prometheus fork with the xrate/xincrease additions. It's far from an
> ideal solution, but seeing how the xrate proposal is going nowhere (and
> my posts to the Prometheus dev group also get consistently marked as spam),
> it's at least something. Would that help anyone?
>
> 
> You are receiving this because you are subscribed to this thread.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/grafana/grafana/issues/9705#issuecomment-376920662>,
